summary: This is the sealed indictment and related arrest warrant and docket entries for Ghislaine Maxwell from the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York. It details six criminal counts against her, including conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury, related to her alleged role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls from 1994 to 1997. This document contains a segment of testimony from an unidentified witness denying knowledge of Jeffrey Epstein's sexual activities with others and denying giving massages. It is followed by court documents related to the initial appearance and removal hearing of Ghislaine Maxwell in the District of New Hampshire on July 2, 2020, including an indictment, a public access findings order, and a commitment order to transfer her to the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case. The documents pertain to her indictment, initial appearance, and removal hearing on charges including conspiracy to entice minors and perjury.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to in witness testimony regarding sexual activities. The witness claims she was not aware he was having sexual activities with anyone else during the time she was with him.

persons.name: Andrea K. Johnstone
persons.context: Presided over Ghislaine Maxwell's initial appearance and removal hearing in the District of New Hampshire. Issued the public access findings order and commitment order.

persons.name: Lawrence Vogelman
persons.context: Listed as the attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell in the commitment order and noted as present at the removal hearing.

persons.name: Lisa Margaret Smith
persons.context: Issuing officer who signed the arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell on June 29, 2020.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell as the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Described as having a close personal and professional relationship; Maxwell allegedly assisted Epstein in recruiting, grooming, and abusing minor victims.
Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his various properties during the period of the alleged conspiracy.
Vogelman represented Maxwell during her initial court appearance (removal hearing) on July 2, 2020.
Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority bringing the indictment against Maxwell.

events.title: Arrest and Initial Hearing of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested, and a removal hearing was held via video conference before Magistrate Judge Andrea K. Johnstone. She waived identity hearing and was committed to the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Issuance of Arrest Warrant
events.description: U.S. Magistrate Judge Lisa Margaret Smith signed an arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell based on a sealed indictment.

events.title: Period of Alleged Conspiracy and Abuse
events.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein conspired to entice and transport minor girls across state lines and internationally for the purpose of sexual abuse.

events.title: Maxwell's First Perjurious Deposition
events.description: During a civil deposition, Maxwell allegedly gave false testimony, denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme to recruit underage girls for sexual massages and claiming she was unaware of interacting with anyone under 18 other than the plaintiff.

events.title: Maxwell's Second Perjurious Deposition
events.description: During a civil deposition, Maxwell allegedly gave false testimony, denying awareness or knowledge of sex toys or devices used in sexual activities at Epstein's Palm Beach house.

events.title: Maxwell's Initial Appearance and Removal Hearing
events.description: A video/telephonic hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell's initial appearance and removal to the Southern District of New York, held before Magistrate Judge Andrea K. Johnstone.

events.title: Issuance of Indictment
events.description: An indictment is filed against Ghislaine Maxwell in the Southern District of New York, charging her with conspiracy, enticement of minors, transportation of a minor, and perjury.

events.title: Court Order on Public Access
events.description: Judge Johnstone issues a detailed order finding that conducting Maxwell's hearing via video/telephone due to COVID-19 constitutes a necessary partial closure, not a total closure, of the proceedings.

events.title: Commitment to Another District
events.description: Judge Johnstone orders the U.S. Marshal to transport Ghislaine Maxwell from the District of New Hampshire to the Southern District of New York to face charges.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Residence)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for the indictment)
District of New Hampshire, Concord (location of initial removal hearing)
White Plains, NY (location where warrant was issued)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted on six counts: conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and two counts of perjury.

The indictment alleges Maxwell played a central role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of at least three minor victims (identified as Minor Victim-1, -2, -3) as young as 14 years old from 1994 to 1997.

Maxwell allegedly used tactics such as befriending victims, taking them shopping or to movies, discussing sexual topics, undressing in front of them, and encouraging them to give massages to Epstein to normalize abuse.
Abuse and grooming allegedly occurred at multiple Epstein properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and at Maxwell's residence in London.
Maxwell is accused of committing perjury during 2016 civil depositions by denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme to recruit underage girls and denying awareness of sex toys at his properties.

A witness testifies she was not aware Jeffrey Epstein was having sexual activities with anyone other than herself and two other women on specific occasions during the 1990s and 2000s, and denies ever giving massages to Epstein or a minor victim.

Ghislaine Maxwell is indicted on charges including conspiracy to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts, transportation of a minor with intent to engage in criminal sexual activity, and perjury.
Maxwell's initial court appearance on July 2, 2020, was conducted via video conference due to the COVID-19 pandemic, with public access provided telephonically.
The court found the video/telephonic hearing was a justified partial closure necessary to protect public health, not a total secret proceeding.
Maxwell was ordered to be transferred from New Hampshire to the Southern District of New York to face the charges.
